intro: Fumaria sarcocapnoides, commonly known as the purple fumitory, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fumariaceae. It is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from pale yellow to deep purple. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, typical of the Fabaceae family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Fumaria sarcocapnoides is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate floral display.
